actions.name: Rage
actions.description: Enter a furious state for 1 minute (concentration not used). You gain damage resistance to bludgeoning/piercing/slashing, advantage on Strength checks and saves, and bonus to melee damage. Ends early if you are knocked unconscious or if you voluntarily end it.

actions.name: Reckless Attack
actions.description: When you make a first attack on your turn, you can attack recklessly to gain advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

actions.name: Danger Sense
actions.description: You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects you can see, such as traps and spells.

actions.name: Feral Instinct (Reactive)
actions.description: You can act normally on the first round of combat if you are surprised or take an opportunity to act (flavor/DM adjudicated).

actions.name: Totem/Path Feature (Example)
actions.description: A subclass feature granted by your Primal Path (e.g., Bear resistances, Eagle mobility). Use according to subclass rules.

actions.name: Bardic Inspiration
actions.description: Give a creature an inspiration die that it can add to an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw. Die size scales with level.

actions.name: Vicious Mockery
actions.description: A cantrip that deals psychic damage and imposes disadvantage on the target's next attack roll if it fails a Wisdom saving throw.

actions.name: Jack of All Trades (Passive)
actions.description: You gain a bonus to any ability check not already including your proficiency bonus, equal to half your proficiency bonus.

actions.name: Cutting Words
actions.description: Use your reaction to subtract your Bardic Inspiration die from an enemy's attack roll, ability check, or damage roll.

actions.name: Song of Rest
actions.description: While taking a short rest, use soothing music or oration to help revitalize allies; they regain extra hit points when spending Hit Dice.

actions.name: Spellcasting (Bard)
actions.description: Cast known spells from the Bard list. Casting time varies by spell. Some require concentration.

actions.name: Channel Divinity
actions.description: Use your Channel Divinity once per short rest to fuel domain features (e.g., Turn Undead, Sacred Flame-like effects) according to your Divine Domain.

actions.name: Turn Undead
actions.description: Present your holy symbol to frighten undead within range; undead that fail a Wisdom save are turned (flee) for 1 minute.

actions.name: Divine Strike / Potent Spellcasting (Example)
actions.description: Add extra radiant or spellcasting-based damage to weapon attacks or spells once per round (domain dependent).

actions.name: Spellcasting (Cleric)
actions.description: Cast prepared cleric spells from the cleric spell list. Many spells require concentration (e.g., Bless).

actions.name: Lay on Hands (via multiclass/party support) — note: typically Paladin
actions.description: Heal or restore a small amount if a setting allows (usually Paladin feature; clerics have Cure Wounds spell).

actions.name: Wild Shape
actions.description: Transform into a beast you have seen that satisfies CR and other limitations. Assume the beast's game statistics while keeping mental stats and class features that don't require armor/weapons.

actions.name: Spellcasting (Druid)
actions.description: Cast druid spells (some require concentration). Many spells manipulate nature, summon, or heal.

actions.name: Wild Shape (Bonus/Move Options)
actions.description: Some Druid Circle features grant movement or other non-action transformations while in beast form.

actions.name: Druidic Rituals
actions.description: Cast certain spells as rituals (if known), taking extra time but not expending a spell slot.

actions.name: Speak with Animals / Animal Handling (Nature)
actions.description: Use spells or skill checks to communicate with or influence animals; may include Animal Handling checks.

actions.name: Second Wind
actions.description: Briefly regain hit points equal to a small die + Fighter level. Usable once per short rest.

actions.name: Action Surge
actions.description: On your turn, you can take one additional Action. Usable once per short rest (scales at higher levels).

actions.name: Second Attack (Extra Attack)
actions.description: Make multiple weapon attacks when you take the Attack action, according to your Extra Attack feature.

actions.name: Maneuver (Battle Master example)
actions.description: Spend superiority dice to perform maneuvers like Trip, Disarm, Riposte, or Precision Attack affecting attack rolls or damage.

actions.name: Indomitable (Reroll Save)
actions.description: Reroll a failed saving throw once per long rest (or limited uses).

actions.name: Flurry of Blows
actions.description: Spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a Bonus Action after taking the Attack action.

actions.name: Step of the Wind
actions.description: Spend 1 ki point to take the Disengage or Dash action as a Bonus Action, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

actions.name: Stunning Strike
actions.description: Spend 1 ki point to attempt to stun a target you hit with a melee weapon attack; target must succeed on a Constitution save or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

actions.name: Deflect Missiles
actions.description: Reduce ranged weapon damage you would take; you can catch and throw it back if you reduce damage to 0.

actions.name: Unarmored Movement (Mobility)
actions.description: Gain bonus movement speed and special movement abilities while not wearing armor or using a shield.

actions.name: Lay on Hands
actions.description: Restore a pool of hit points that you can spend to heal creatures. Usable a number of points equal to Paladin level × 5 per long rest.

actions.name: Divine Smite
actions.description: Spend a spell slot to deal extra radiant damage on a melee weapon hit, scaling with slot level.

actions.name: Divine Sense
actions.description: Detect celestial, fiend, and undead presences within range for a short period.

actions.name: Aura (Passive)
actions.description: Grant beneficial effects (such as saving throw bonuses) to allies within a radius while you are conscious.

actions.name: Spellcasting (Paladin)
actions.description: Paladins can cast spells from the paladin list; some spells require concentration (e.g., Bless).

actions.name: Hunter's Mark (Spell/Feature)
actions.description: Mark a target to deal extra damage on hits and track it more easily. Requires concentration.

actions.name: Favored Enemy (Passive)
actions.description: Gain bonuses to tracking and intelligence about certain creature types chosen at character creation.

actions.name: Primeval Awareness
actions.description: Spend a spell slot to sense creatures of a type within a radius for a short time.

actions.name: Colossus Slayer / Ranger Combat Feature
actions.description: Deal extra damage to a creature once per turn when you hit it (features vary by archetype).

actions.name: Spellcasting (Ranger)
actions.description: Cast ranger spells (some require concentration) for utility, tracking, and combat.

actions.name: Sneak Attack
actions.description: Once per turn when you hit with an attack that qualifies (advantage or eligible ally within 5 feet), deal extra precision damage dice.

actions.name: Cunning Action
actions.description: Take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a Bonus Action on each of your turns.

actions.name: Evasion (Defensive)
actions.description: When subjected to an area effect that allows a Dex save for half, take no damage on success and half on failure.

actions.name: Use Thieves' Tools / Disarm Trap
actions.description: Use thieves' tools to pick locks or disarm traps with a Dexterity check and proficiency bonus if proficient.

actions.name: Hide/Move Silently
actions.description: Attempt to hide or move stealthily using Dexterity (Stealth) checks. Rogues excel at stealth tactics.

actions.name: Metamagic (Twinned/Quickened/etc.)
actions.description: Spend sorcery points to alter spells (e.g., Quickened Spell to change casting time to Bonus Action, Twinned Spell to target another creature).

actions.name: Sorcery Points (Spend)
actions.description: Convert spell slots into sorcery points or vice versa and spend points to fuel Metamagic or other features.

actions.name: Spellcasting (Sorcerer)
actions.description: Cast known sorcerer spells using spell slots. Many spells require concentration.

actions.name: Sorcerous Origin Feature (Example)
actions.description: Use a bloodline feature (e.g., Draconic resilience passive armor boost, Wild Magic surge trigger) as specified by origin.

actions.name: Eldritch Blast (Cantrip)
actions.description: A ranged spell attack dealing force damage; scales with level (multiple beams at higher levels). Frequently paired with invocations.

actions.name: Hex
actions.description: Curse a creature, dealing extra necrotic damage on a hit and imposing disadvantage on an ability check of a chosen ability. Requires concentration.

actions.name: Pact Boon (Use)
actions.description: Use your pact boon (Blade, Chain, or Tome) to summon a pact weapon, a familiar, or enhance spellcasting depending on pact choice.

actions.name: Eldritch Invocation (Passive/Active)
actions.description: Benefit from permanent or activated invocations (e.g., Agonizing Blast to add Charisma modifier to Eldritch Blast damage).

actions.name: Hexblade Curse / Patron Feature (Bonus)
actions.description: Apply a curse or patron-granted effect that boosts damage against a target or grants critical benefits when the target dies.

actions.name: Spellcasting (Wizard)
actions.description: Cast spells from the wizard spell list using prepared spells from your spellbook. Many spells require concentration.

actions.name: Arcane Recovery
actions.description: Once per day when you finish a short rest, recover a number of expended spell slots with a combined level equal to or less than half your wizard level (rounded up).

actions.name: Ritual Casting
actions.description: Cast a spell as a ritual if it has the ritual tag and you have it prepared; takes additional time but doesn't expend a spell slot.

actions.name: Counterspell / Shield (Reaction Spells)
actions.description: Use reaction spells like Counterspell to negate another spell or Shield to increase AC against an attack.

actions.name: Identify / Scribe or Copy Spellbook
actions.description: Identify magical effects or copy spells into your spellbook through time and components (scribing).

actions.name: Infuse Item
actions.description: Imbue a nonmagical object with an infusion to grant it magical properties for a limited time. Number of active infusions is limited by level.

actions.name: Spellcasting (Artificer)
actions.description: Cast artificer spells using prepared spells and spell slots; many spells are utility and require concentration when specified.

actions.name: Tinker / Tool Use
actions.description: Use tools to craft, repair, or activate magical or mechanical devices. Artificers have expertise with certain tools.

actions.name: Magic Item Attunement (Manage)
actions.description: Attune to magic items and manage artificer item abilities, sometimes using class features to recharge or empower items.

actions.name: Weapon/Armor Enhancement (Experimental)
actions.description: Temporarily enhance a weapon or armor using a feature or infusion (DM adjudicated for homebrew/unique infusions).
